p: To capture stand structure, the height distribution of trees in each stand was surveyed by means of 3D surface model reconstructions. We used largely overlapping high‐resolution (<10 cm/px) aerial imagery obtained with an unmanned aerial vehicle. Canopy height models were derived and single trees with a height >2.5 m automatically delineated (Hyyppa, Kelle, Lehikoinen, & Inkinen, 2001; Zarco‐Tejada, Diaz‐Varela, Angileri, & Loudjani, 2014). For each stand, the trees were grouped in three elevation classes, using the 25th and 75th percentile as class breaks. Then, tree height distributions were plotted for each elevation class.
